TopicTitle: Do you have a screenshot that makes you laugh every time?

Articles.Content:
Have I posted this?

![hMjsekb.png](http://i.imgur.com/hMjsekb.png)

Unfortunately the funniest NON-Kraken thing I have seen in KSP wouldn't be done justice in an image. And regrettably I don't have video. I will attempt to describe the funny in text form.

I had a Kerbal transferring in orbit from a large space craft to a station that was about 750m away. I had fired RCS on the maneuvering pack to intercept the station. Now, a friend of mine and I start talking, and the next thing I know, I hear a \*THUD\* (Thank you so much Collision FX ![:)](//kerbal-forum-uploads.s3.us-west-2.amazonaws.com/emoticons/default_k_smiley.gif) ) and look up. My Kerbal slammed into the station and the impact was apparently 100% on his face/helmet. So what I saw was the poor little guy tumbling end over end (VERY rapidly ![:)](//kerbal-forum-uploads.s3.us-west-2.amazonaws.com/emoticons/default_k_smiley.gif) ) like a football headed for the uprights. It took me a good while to stop laughing and recover the Kerbal ![:D](//kerbal-forum-uploads.s3.us-west-2.amazonaws.com/emoticons/default_k_cheesy.gif)

![screenshot202.png](https://lh3.googleusercontent.com/-wg5zUovZ2kI/VYP3B4zWVRI/AAAAAAAABc4/qCEHQaqy1kA/s800/screenshot202.png)

"Pardon me, captain; do you have a few minutes to talk about our lord and savior MOAR BOOSTERZ?"

![7A331FAA206AB45B569514D9499470B3BFD27433](http://images.akamai.steamusercontent.com/ugc/34122502847463004/7A331FAA206AB45B569514D9499470B3BFD27433/)

Is someone missiong in the vessel?

Don't play on the stairs!

![screenshot30.png](https://dl.dropboxusercontent.com/u/20576590/KSP/Funny/screenshot30.png)

one from me

![LAdqihg.jpg](http://i.imgur.com/LAdqihg.jpg)

> 50m of KAS winch cable was obviously not enough to abseil down the VAB...

I'm going to ask Kospy to take away your harpoon privileges. That was genuinely disturbing. 

I wonder if Kospy would add a suction cup. Not much good in space, but better than seeing the CAT scan showing the harpoon embedded in Jeb's adenoids.
Usually it is to late to take a picture.

![n71QSow.png](http://i.imgur.com/n71QSow.png)

When you learn how to dock and make spaceplanes.

> 
> My profile picture was not entirely photoshopped... It actually came from a real screenshot.

I shall not even ask how a truck cabin ended up in LKO.

Already posted in the "What did you do today" thread, but...

[![449528KSPboom02letitgo.jpg](http://img11.hostingpics.net/pics/449528KSPboom02letitgo.jpg)](http://www.hostingpics.net/viewer.php?id=449528KSPboom02letitgo.jpg)

Yes, let it go.
Kerb #1 "Welp, I guess this design didn't work out so well." Kerb #2 "I thought I had it there for a while." Kerb #3 "Yeah, kind of looks like a beached whale!"

AH HA HA

[![screenshot6075_zpsrpazfwqt.png](http://i1383.photobucket.com/albums/ah315/Yukon0009/screenshot6075_zpsrpazfwqt.png)](http://s1383.photobucket.com/user/Yukon0009/media/screenshot6075_zpsrpazfwqt.png.html)

^

How did you do that? The only other time I've seen that is from RIC!
A bug stemming from either TweakbleEverything, Fairing Tweaker, Tweakscale or a combo of all three.

Who said Kerbals couldn't fly? 

![jDY1ufd.png](http://i.imgur.com/jDY1ufd.png)![Zm6ssJd.png](http://i.imgur.com/Zm6ssJd.png)![tzwwE3E.png](http://i.imgur.com/tzwwE3E.png)

She has a couple of tons of highly flammable fuel against one ear and an explosively operated parachute against the other...but she's still happy!

![afskRT7.jpg](http://i.imgur.com/afskRT7.jpg)

![6VrrO7s.jpg](http://i.imgur.com/6VrrO7s.jpg)

I was screwing around with a P-40 Warhawk and a PB-1 Nancy I had made and this screenshot was right before losing the wing (and totally erasing the poor Nancy). Jeb was either totally oblivious to the imminent crash, or was upset with Bob that day.

![1uXvKBs.jpg](http://i.imgur.com/1uXvKBs.jpg)

This was a bomber test gone wrong. These remains flew further than the rest of plane ever managed.

[h=2]Something is wrong...but what ?[/h] 

Can you see what it is ?

I believe its a root issue in TweakableEverything that was squashed a while back, but can still be triggered by an interaction with TweakScale.
